name: Shuksan Creek
description:
A yet to be explored series of falls on the South side of Mt Shuksan.

Details extracted from a FB post by Aaron Young, Sept 2022: https://www.facebook.com/groups/pnwcanyoning/posts/10160175462740789/


I was thinking about y'all when I was out in the middle of nowhere yesterday. Shuksan Creek might be a fun spot to add to your hit list. It's not too horrible to get to and from what I've seen from you nut jobs, the lower canyon is right up your alley. I'll attach some pictures. There's a big, huge, massive, multi-tiered waterfall at the head of the canyon (couldn't find a clear spot to get pictures of, but it looks like several hundred feet tall in multiple tiers). There's a beautiful lower falls as it exits the canyon, another 30-footer just upstream from that, and I saw several small drops that you could probably jump, nice little slides, and all sorts of other stuff as I peered over the side. It's a really cool place.
